content: When using fail "something went wrong", the goal is printed. Is there an existing syntax-level tactic that just calls throwError, but doesn't append the pretty printed goal?

(To #xy, I want to use #guard_msgs to check the behaviour of a syntax-level tactic that is calling fail, but the pretty printed goal has a metavariable number that will change from run to run. Two alternative solutions: don't test this behaviour, or modify #guard_msgs to we can require "the message begins like this, but then can continue arbitrarily".)
I believe the lean testing framework anonymizes metavariables by replacing ?m.NNNN with ?m, #guard_msgs could do the same
